column2: UT DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Utah
column6: UT

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
column4: when you first see the exit sign.
column6: once you have moved into the exit lane.
column8: once you see the toll booth.
column10: before moving into the exit lane.

column2: 2. Parking is not allowed:
column4: on public roads
column6: within 250 feet of a traffic light.
column8: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.
column10: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.

column2: 3. A traffic sign with a red circle around and a slash over a symbol means:
column4: the maneuver shown by the symbol is not allowed.
column6: Do not drive faster than the posted speed limit.
column8: the maneuver shown on the sign can be executed only after coming to a complete stop.
column10: the maneuver shown on the sign should be executed with extreme caution.

column2: 4. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: The light will soon change from green to red.
column6: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column8: Drive with caution.

column2: 5. When you get in a car to drive, the first thing you should do is:
column4: adjust your seat.
column6: adjust the steering wheel.
column8: check your rear view mirror.

column2: 6. Emergency vehicles:
column4: may follow each other.
column6: may use a loudspeaker to give instructions.
column8: have the right-of-way when using siren and red/blue lights.

column2: 7. When you are in a line of traffic that is crossing a railroad track that has no signals or gates:
column4: you may pass slower drivers crossing the track.
column6: before you start to cross, you need to make sure there is space to get all the way across the tracks without stopping.
column8: you have the right of way and do not need to check for trains.

column2: 8. To safely cross a railroad, drivers should:
column4: look both ways only if the red light is flashing.
column6: listen and look both ways, then proceed if it is safe to do so.
column8: drive across quickly if a train is approaching, or if it is too close, stop and then back up.
column10: stop within 10 feet of all railroad crossings.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column4: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
column6: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 10. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
column4: low-beam lights.
column6: high beam lights.
column8: emergency flashers.

column2: 11. Drivers must yield to pedestrians:
column4: even when the pedestrian crosses the street without looking both ways.
column6: only if the pedestrian is on the same side of the road.
column8: if the pedestrian signals to the driver that the driver must stop.
column10: only if the pedestrian is in a crosswalk.

column2: 12. When driving on slick roads, drivers should:
column4: drive as they would on dry roads.
column6: accelerate quickly.
column8: take turns more slowly.

column2: 13. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: slow down and enter the intersection.
column6: signal other vehicles to stop.
column8: come to a complete stop.
column10: enter the intersection and then stop.

column2: 14. This road sign:
column4: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column6: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column8: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.

column2: 15. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
column6: Look through your back window for children.
column8: Rely on your mirrors.

column2: 16. Drivers who eat and drink while driving:
column4: have no driving errors.
column6: tend to be more aggressive.
column8: may have trouble controlling their vehicles.

column2: 17. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column4: stop much more quickly
column6: accelerate much faster
column8: drive much faster

column2: 18. To avoid having to make an emergency stop while driving in traffic, drivers should:
column4: sound their horn to warn other drivers.
column6: look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.
column8: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column10: drive in the right lane only.

column2: 19. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: that there's a school zone ahead.
column6: what is not allowed.
column8: the law.

column2: 20. Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
column4: to reduce your speed.
column6: to turn on your windshield wipers.
column8: to look for road edge markings to guide you.

column2: 21. When driving near light rail vehicles, drivers should:
column4: expect trains on any track at any time.
column6: never drive around lowered crossing gates.
column8: always obey signs and traffic signals.

column2: 22. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column4: never take precedence over
column6: take precedence over
column8: must obey

column2: 23. If an aggressive driver cuts you off, you should:
column4: stay calm and get out of the aggressive driver's way.
column6: call the police immediately.
column8: look towards the left side of the road.

column2: 24. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
column4: a speed limit sign.
column6: a stop sign.
column8: a crossbuck sign.

column2: 25. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: they cannot go straight ahead.
column6: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.
column8: a divided highway is ahead.
column10: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
